body: At sunset on Friday, the sky over Plumb Beach in Brooklyn was Kodachrome blue, orange and yellow, like the colors on a chamber-of-commerce postcard. Winds lifted paragliders using rainbow airfoil wings. Kitesurfers leaned and swayed in the waves of Sheepshead Bay. The narrow finger of beach had dunes and powdery sand that would not seem out of
title: A Man's Death Shines a Light on a Shady Parking Lot

author: E-mail: parenting@nytimes.com
body: SUSAN TORRES, 44, is a divorced, single mother of four happy, healthy children, ages 11 to 25. She got her college degree just a few years ago, supports her family as a high school English teacher, lives in a nice, tree-shaded home in this upscale suburb, and because she is such a high-energy, optimistic sort of human being -- ''I'm a cannonball,''
title: PARENTING; Single Mother, Creator of Miracles
